JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Stanislav Shevchuk;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent Mr PERSON and the Head of ORG Office PERSON NORP , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG , GPE ( ORG міський суд PERSON області ) , seeking compensation for work - related injuries he had sustained on DATE and DATE .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaints as unsubstantiated .
On DATE the ORG upheld the decision of the first - instance court . The court pronounced its decision in the applicant ’s presence .

On DATE the applicant requested the President of ORG to provide him with a copy of ORG of Appeal decision . He stated that the time - limit for lodging a cassation appeal had been reduced and he still had not received a copy of the court of appeal decision .

On DATE the President of ORG informed the applicant about the new procedural time - limit for lodging a cassation appeal introduced on DATE and that he could lodge an appeal before the case file was returned to the first - instance court .
On DATE ORG informed the applicant that his complaints that the judgments of the domestic courts were unfair were outside the scope of its constitutional jurisdiction .
On DATE ORG notified the applicant that the ruling of DATE could be appealed in cassation only through the first - instance court .

On CARDINAL and DATE and DATE , the Deputy President and the President of ORG of Appeal informed the applicant that it was impossible to appeal against the ruling of DATE to ORG as the time - limit for lodging an appeal in cassation had expired .

At the time of the second - instance appeal decision , the first paragraph of LAW ORG provided that a cassation appeal should be lodged within DATE of the appeal decision or within DATE of the decision of the first - instance court , if the latter decision had not been appealed under the normal appellate procedure .

On DATE ORG passed a law amending the ORG ( “ LAW ) , including LAW in question . It came into force on DATE . The new wording of Article CARDINAL created a DATE time - limit for lodging a cassation application against the decision of an appeal court .
Under LAW a cassation appeal should be lodged via the court of first instance that had dealt with the case .
